content: knitted crown this fun little crown is surprisingly quick and simple to knit up yet the results look fancy and elegant you don t have to tell how easy it was if you don t want to this is worked from the top down and the decreases form the points at the top of the crown yarn worsted weight about 25-30 yards if using contrasting colors for bobble gems you will need a few scraps of contrast yarns a few yards each needle us size 7 16 circular or dpns/magic loop if you prefer gauge 4 st/6 row per inch stockinette glossary of terms yo yarn over wrap yarn around needle the same direction you would to make a stitch but without knitting a stitch this will create the little lacy holes in the crown cdd centered double-decrease slip 2 stitches from one needle to the other as if you were going to knit 2 together knit the next stitch normally then pass the two slipped stitches off the needle 2 stitches decreased **important note this decrease is worked knitwise even on the purl row for the top garter border ** there are other methods of double-decrease but these tend to result in a stitch that leans to one direction or the other if you prefer this look any of these decrease methods may be substituted mb make bobble transfer last worked stitch back to working needle k yo k yo k into the same stitch turn purl those 5 stitches turn again k2tog k1 k2tog slip second stitch over then third stitch if you want you could also knit the bobble part in a contrasting color for gems at the points of the crown for bobbles in contrasting color switch to cc after working decrease stitches k yo k yo k into the same stitch using cc turn and purl 5 turn again k2tog k1 switch back to mc k2tog slip 2 cc stitches over mc stitch break cc yarn continue in pattern with mc until next bobble cast on 140 stitches for large size 126 stitches for toddler/child size i find using the cable cast on method makes a very pretty edge and ends up stretchy enough that the finished crown fits a wide range of sizes http //www knitty com/issuesummer05/featsum05tt html row 1-4 below worked in garter stitch r 1 *k9 8 cdd k8 7 pm to end of round place contrasting color marker at end of round and join being careful not to twist r 2 rs p8 7 cdd remember to work cdd knitwise optional mb p7 6 sm to end of round r 3 *k7 6 cdd k6 5 sm to end r 4 *p6 5 cdd knitwise p5 4 sm to end row 5-14 below worked in stockinette stitch knit all row round 5 and all odd numbered row knit all stitches round 6 *k1 yo k4 3 cdd k4 3 yo sm repeat to end of round round 8 *k2 yo k3
